author: Randi Millman-Brown
text: Ordering was easy but the size of the item was not accurate- the shoulder bag was smaller than I thought. Also, the bag had items left in it by the previous owner.
title: Ok but not great

author: customer
text: I ordered a purse that I was very excited about, but when it arrived I was very disappointed. The purse was very cheaply made and a obvious knock off. The site states that they have experts that review authenticity but in this case this $900 purse was made of patent leather had plastic straps and burlap on the inside. The original purse was leather with gold metal straps and leather on the inside. The shade was not even available by that designer that they sent me. Even though the sites says all sales are final they did refund me my money for the fake purse. I actually took it back to the store to get the refund and they did have real purses in the store, they just didn’t send me one.
title: Fake purse

author: Renee
text:
I was sent the wrong item. I sent an email with pictures and also called customer service then finally reached someone via text. It turns out that the top I ordered was no longer available. Why would TRR decide to send me a similar top instead of notifying me that the one I ordered was not available? It was the same brand, color and fabric but a different style. I’m not sure if the email and text responses are automated, but it stated that they were sorry that my order didn't meet my expectations…well…I did expect I would receive the top I ordered, not one that resembled it.
Conclusion: after taking photos, emailing, calling, texting, printing a return label, packing, driving to UPS, I get a notification for my credit MINUS shipping/handling. I’m back on the phone to customer service to explain the whole thing again and why I should not be charged for a return due to an error by TRR. I finally got it resolved but what a waste of time and effort to end up with nothing. Finally, I would like to believe that receiving the wrong shirt was an honest mistake, but what bothers me is that the one I ordered was NOT available, so it’s not the case of someone accidentally packing a similar shirt. Maybe they thought it was close enough and I wouldn't notice?
title: Similar but Different

author: customer
text: I paid for gift packaging for this gift and it didn't arrived gift wrapped. Please honor services when you have rec'd the funds during check-out to do so.

author: Campbell
text: The selection and prices are good, but the size of the item I bought had been incorrectly entered on the website. The shoes were a 'Narrow' fitting and hence too tight. Took me ages to get customer service to waive the return postage. Additionally, I was unable to recoup the $25 introductory discount, which I had used to purchase them.
title: Not an encouraging first experience

author: Frugal Jane
text: There is no doubt the selection is one if the best and pricing most of the time is in line with used products. I have noticed a lack of full disclosure on damage which is disappointing especially if it is not returnable.
title: Great Inventory and/but…

author: customer
text: Consignment takes a very long time. My items have been there now 2 months and are just being posted. I don’t know that consigning with them was the best idea.
title: Consignment takes a very long time

author: customer
text: Product purchased was an elaborately embellished dress with large sequins, whoever shipped the item did so incorrectly. The highly fragile dress was placed in a garment bag ( great ) and then incorrectly put in a large box with no packing cushioning.  The results were the dress was smacking all over inside the box on its way across the country to me and no surprise arrived badly damaged- large amount of sequins ripped off the dress and lay in the bottom of the garment bag along with a large amount of the sequins that are still on a dress are barley hanging on. Such an insult to Prabal Gurung and his teams beautiful work. It’s final sale so I can’t return it.
title: Terrible packaging
